title: Inconsistency in docs/config_space.md: Definition 4.1.1 (x_j in Lambda)
description: Definition 4.1.1 in `docs/config_space.md` states that anyon positions x_j belong to Lambda^N. However, Lambda is defined as a set of dimensionless site indices (0 to n-1) in Assumption A4.1.2, while elsewhere x_j are referred to as physical positions with units of length (e.g., in ยง4.1.3, which defines x_j = epsilon * j). This creates an inconsistency. The definition needs to be clarified to distinguish between site indices and physical positions, or Lambda must be consistently defined. Planning ref: ยง4.1.1. Acceptance: Definition 4.1.1 is mathematically consistent with other definitions of lattice sites, physical positions, and Lambda.
